On all counts, (and I've heard that C-Fu's Asian customers have been fleeing to China King), C-Fu still matches up well with its local competitors and has improved as the stiff competition of other dim sum eateries has grown in Chandler.  To answer some other critics, we don't live in San Francisco or Hong Kong, and this place (or any other local restaurant) won't match up to San Francisco, LA, or Mott Street (NYC), but it comes pretty close, and you can't ask for too much more than that when you live in Phoenix.    Overall, C-Fu is a decent place to go, and in the Valley, it is one of the best dim sum places you can bring your custom to, IMHO.

fHG9rj4RX6L_EFsNohLRNw.text: I was a little disappointed with both the variety and quality of the dim sum.  There are the standard har gow, sui main, egg tarts -- but they all miss the spot and there was something amiss with each one of them.  The price was okay (around $15 per person) but I wouldn't be racing back here.

drKyxBHrpkcFp_TM9T1znQ.text: Not long ago I went and got takeout - and everything tasted kind of fishy.

LqlRo2nc1QvJfq6vad1H2Q.text: Pretty good Chinese food.  Great atmosphere.

CqHGlDE8cqZH_UcIkLqJ1A.text: Who pays attention to health code violations anyway? I can tell you how I know this place is good: every single time I go here for dinner I'm the only non-Asian in the place.  So there you have it, if it's good enough for the locals it's good enough for me.  I've been to a brazillon (as  Pres G.W. Bush would say) Chinese Restaurants back east, including Philly and NYC and this place can definitely hold it's own.  Yes, it's a little dirty, yes the service is spotty, they are not constantly coming around refilling your water everytime you take a sip, but the food is first rate!  I recommend the Crispy Spinach '2' dish that is on the menu under house specialties; it's a bed of fried spinach with a spicy chicken, shrimp, and vegetable medley on top. fantastic!  The wonton soup is also very good, a little different than I'm used to; the wontons here are filled with meat and seafood.  All the seafood at C-Fu is wonderful, very fresh and prepared the way you ask for it.   Keeping up the "Friday night is Chinese food night" tradition that my dad bestowed upon me as a kid, I typically find myself eating here or at least getting take out once a week. I give C-Fu two thumbs up.

kbOPuqe01VlM1gw5FRmY0g.text: I've never had dim sum before but we've been here a few times. The food is good, tasty, and average. The bready things with meat or custard are awesome and some of the shrimps are good, too. I've never had a problem getting served here or missing carts. This is definitely a place to go with friends or a group so you can split up the bill.

i1R4zi6r29oSriUsURHLeg.text: When I was growing up in the area, C-Fu was THE place for Dim Sum. No matter when we went, there was always a full lobby to wait behind. Parking lot was full from C-Fu alone, and eventually you'd recognize some of the staff, like the guy in the Hawaiian shirt who always had my calamari. It's almost incredulous that after almost a decade in the Bay only a few places could beat my standard.  After all those years, I went back with my bro and I could barely recognize the place. On a Saturday with an almost ghost-like parking lot, I was shocked by no wait, and further with over half the seating empty. With maybe a quarter of the staff I'd remember, there were literally 4 tables occupied. A lot of the staff seemed younger too, as opposed to being completely swarmed by Chinese or Vietnamese speaking staff.  Unlike Mekong or any other dim sum place here, C-Fu swarmed me with literally every cart over the course of 2 minutes. Miraculously even with a much smaller selection they had every item we wanted, and we were off to the races.  Thankfully my faith was restored with the first bite. Everything I've had from the fresh turnip cakes to the ha gow tasted exactly as I remembered - excellent. But it wasn't without issue. Without a full house there was no steady flow in the kitchen, meaning a lot of dishes were sitting out. Calamari, chow mein, fried shrimp balls, green beans - while some of these favorites were cooked and seasoned to point, they were so cold to bite into.   The potential of C-Fu to me has not gone down. Perhaps Mekong or other newer dim sum joints are drawing away traffic. However, I was told Sundays were much busier. I would advise going when it's fuller to get a more traditional experience. I'll definitely be back for that.

DNkmfUHr83LFcpCX3OZq2w.text: Do not go to this place to eat. Unprofessional managers and owner. The foods were not good either.I came to my friend wedding party recently and had a terrible experience in this place. My best friend had hold a wedding in this restaurant and have told the manager in advance that  they want to be the only group on that day. The restaurant manager had accepted the offer.But on the day of the wedding, the manager have accept one more group party next to our group. Both parties have loud music and there was a lady in other group on the other side came over during the wedding ceremony "yelling and cursing" in the stage nonstop. She was keep standing there and refused to go back to the other side. I would never go to this place again. Wedding is a once a life moment and you don't want that special time to be ruined. If I was you, I would stay away from this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of C-Fu Gourmet - Chandler, AZ, United States

71iaqsAL27rJc6iX-byLQg.text: More or less 3.5 stars as the whole duck was actually quite tasty. I was hesitant to pay this place a visit after I read the reviews of how this restaurant went downhill throughout the years. The interior of the restaurant definitely had its better days: the floor was less desired, thundering automatic doors, and a fish tank that screamed to be cleaned (pictures ahead). I ordered the whole roasted duck that came out warm which was odd as most restaurants I have ordered at always served them luke warm. Definitely a plus for me as well as coming with rice, and sauce of the duck. The duck was good, you can actually taste the aromatics they used to flavor the duck- ginger, garlic, onions! The skin was crisp and succulent, paired nicely with the rice. Overall I'll come back for the whole roasted duck again but might have to stay away from eating there.

HcpqhOYhGzvSqhw9MokGvg.text: We haven't been here in a couple of years. Both of us were a bit worried after reading all of the low ratings post new management, but we decided to go for it. Stuffed eggplant hotpot was good.  The sizzling steak and scallops was good, too.  Service was acceptable, even though they were not busy. We will be back, next time for Dim Sum.

3l2b5NWAi1uLkQiBdTkGmw.text: Another disappointment. I use to love this place, it was one of my favorite dim-sum hangouts on the weekend. New owners just don't seem to care when you walk/in their like yeah just grab a seat. The fish tank hasn't been cleaned out there's mold geezzzz. Food was ok, wait-staff was nice.

f_S2XwokxTdI-FYUXrATvA.text: The servers were all very friendly and eager to serve but the food fell short. Here are the things I would recommend trying...shumai, bbq pork buns, Hargow, steamed rice noodle.   Avoid the spareribs, bean curd, fried taro cake and iced coffee.   If you're looking for a dim sum quick fix and don't want to wait in line this places will do the trick.

g1ct0gerltKtUZzuyag6Yw.text: Horrible example of dim sum, buffet. Waited to order, tpok forever. Dirty, crumbs on ground, table sticky, service lagged. Actually saw a roach. Not going there again.

GUZdGmPNOMDGXxVclh5JkQ.text: I gave it a 4-star because of the price.  Small dish $2.30, medium dish $2.99.  It is the cheapest in AZ.  The Phoenix Palace across charges more and it is not as good. The best deal is the Toro (radish) cake.  They are huge.  The are 2 inches thick.  I ordered an extra order, took it home, cut them in thinner pieces and pan fried them so that they are crispy. I highly recommend this place for cheap dim Sum. If you have not been to the AYCE  Lunch Dim Sum buffet at the Casino Arizona, you should try it.  It is off I-17 and McKelips.  They charge $12.  It is a great buffet without Dim Sum.

tdt_fbd2tuLAzVjoqNr_Fw.text: This place isn't even worthy of 1 star. We were seated very quickly even though there was a party of 10 in front of us. We waited under 5 mins to be seated. Once we were seated it took someone over 5 mins to get our drink order. Drinks were brought out and we told the server that brought the drinks we were ready to order. She said she can't take the orders but would ask someone to come take our order.  The other party that had 10 people in it didn't even get their drink order taken and they were getting a little annoyed that they were being ignored as well.   Well they got the servers attention and she said that she would be right back but since it was well over 15 mins since we sat down I felt that we were being treated not proper. We were calling around to other restaurants seeing if they were busy while sitting inside (no one noticed or cared)  and called 2 places (Phoenix palace and pacific seafood buffet) while we were sitting there We didn't pay for our drinks and just got up and left. From the looks of things the servers and staff was more focused on the other side of the room.  Even though this place is close too our house and it was our first time there we won't be going back there any time soon...   My wife and I went to pacific seafood buffet and had a great time there.  I noticed when I sat down the chairs were dirty / black stained on every chair.  That should have been a tip off too.  C-FU later!!!!

_rudtaRmbTjM5PDeQnw1Tw.text: Looks like it's been sold or changed management to a company called "Golden Crown."  It was very empty, compared to how I remembered it.  Food and service have both suffered.  Our drink order wasn't taken until we were a good 10-15 minutes into the meal.  The sugar cane shrimp was in a pool of oil, the siu mai were mushy with the noodle slipping off, the spare ribs tasted of chemicals, and the coconut custard bread was doughy and inedible.  No sweet rice cakes or custard tarts to be seen.  It's more open with the wall to the sushi bar taken out, but parts of the interior are now very tacky and cheap looking (the rainbow-lit stage, large white floor fans racked on to a light rigging, wheeled partitions blocking off stacked furniture, hand-written "no outside alcohol" signs taped to the fire exit door).  The men's restroom had no paper towels and two hand dryer "shells" with the actual hand drying machine missing.  I will stick with Phoenix Palace across the street by Lee Lee for dim sum.

1anf6WvpMctd5UumLTZtpA.text: Their food improved much after going back for a while. The only thing is the restaurant is kinda humid inside but the employees are very nice. Food is served fast

Photo of C-Fu Gourmet - Chandler, AZ, United States

yfPJVAe1NXPPWMYcoNm9ag.text: Of the dim sum places around this is the better of them.  Recently taken over about a year and a half ago, it still remains a decent place for dim sum lunch.  The food is bette quality because the new owner kept best practices of making noodles from scratch and seafood is brought in from cold waters.  The people are always nice and accommodating which is always an automatic star.  Pick up a dim sum menu and order from there if your not comfortable.  The only downside I have noticed is that True peppers and eggplant were well overlooked but I can overlook that because everything else is fresh and clean.

photos.caption: Photo of C-Fu Gourmet - Chandler, AZ, United States. A little overdone but tasty.
Photo of C-Fu Gourmet - Chandler, AZ, United States. Sticky rice, eggplant, shrimp noodle, peppers, and pork balls.

Em-LZ92QD-YYCL_jr0WskQ.text: I wish there is 0 star option, because the management of this place is really bad to the bone. I was attending my friend wedding. We were having fun until one old lady who also held a conference group from the other side came to interrupt our wedding ceremony. She requested that our music should be turn off because her people having a important discussion from the other side. She was rude and mean. We were kindly told her that she should talk to the manager of this place. The manager just stood there and decided take no  action to stop this old lady from ruining my friend wedding. I am really disappointed with this place. It was my favorite restaurant. I was planning to have my wedding party here, but Now I guess not anymore. I definitely will not come back to this restaurant.

rN_VHdrBlVSWD3NofoiyvA.text: Having been in Arizona for several months now, I have been on the hunt for good Asian cuisine. What can I say... I was pretty spoiled living in LA. (Why can't there be a 24/7 Korean soondubu place here?! But I digress.)  So I consulted Yelp for a good dim sum place one fine Sunday morning. Unfortunately, that morning my friends in town had to drive back to Irvine ASAP, so even though C-Fu Gourmet had the most mediocre Yelp reviews, it was the earliest one open (9:30am while Phoenix Palace opens at 10am) so I brought everyone along to Chandler to see what quality of dim sum Arizona had to offer. It also helped that my coworker recommended C Fu Gourmet, so I had high expectations.   It was.. ok. My party of 5 were the first ones in at 9:30am, so I don't blame them for being a little slow. But the variety of dim sum was underwhelming. Not bad, just nothing spectacular. Plus, their dessert cart was meh!  In the end, we paid about $60 including tip for a party of 5. Service was really slow, even in giving us the check.  I'd come back to C Fu if I really needed dim sum at 9:30am, but if you can stand to wait an extra thirty minutes, I prefer the dim sum and service at Phoenix Palace across the street.  One thing though, the actual restaurant at C Fu Gourmet is much nicer than Phoenix Palace. It looks more impressive and more expensive even though it's the same price in the end. Too bad the food and service don't live up to their looks.

qCQa6z3ePKKBzoEDxlXfdA.text: This restaurant used to be great until it changed owners. I was there recently and every single thing was so bad. I would never go back again. It's so disappointing because I used to really love it.

JUVdr2NKLpldcvyJP7lPoA.text: Before going to  IKEA, we decided to stop off here for Dim Sum. The servers were okay. The look of the dining area needs to be updated. Our first order of Chow Mein was COLD, brrrrr! Even though the mein was covered with aluminum foil, it didn't help. Our Char Siu Bao was tasty and this shrimp ball which turned out to be a ball of rice with stuffed ground shrimp had too much rice and no flavor. Compare that to the fried shrimp ball and the Sugar cane shrimp ball, you lose. The crunch from the both of the shrimp ball's was yummy. We also ordered ShaoMai and HarGaw which was nice and HOT and oh so good. The Sticky Rice was really sticky and COLD. What's happening?? Good thing we ordered hot tea. Our favorite dessert is the Sesame Ball with sweet black bean paste in the center. I also tried their custard which was light and tasty.

Ym-0U7oQdpWGoyQLmCl34Q.text: Great place for a fairly quick and inexpensive lunch. The lunch options are around $7 and include soup (hot and sour or egg drop, egg drop is my fave), a choice or crab wanton or Pork egg roll, and either white or fried rice. They also offer dim sum but I haven't been brace enough to try it. The restaurant is huge and can get busy for dinner on the weekends. Pretty solid place!

iIkVa4JS73yFcw6VjxDFpg.text: There were four friends at lunch today at C-Fu. What a disaster!!! And I'm the one that recommended we go there! At our table we were greeted by an unfriendly, non-smiling young or welcoming young woman. We all ordered water "with lemon" and never got lemon. We placed our orders with difficulty--the girl wasn't explaining the menu items well or didn't answer our questions about certain foods. After waiting awhile the girl brought my entree and set it down in front of me. I was shocked at such disrespect-- went up to the girl at the register by this time. I asked what's going on?!? I've had my food 10 minutes and my other three friends' food has NOT been served! I'll be through eating before my friends even get their food!!! She said oh it's coming out. I said no it isn't!!! Returned to the table and we waited and the others didn't get their food! I'll bet we sat there for 10 minutes or longer before the next entree came which left two friends without their entrees! Waited another 5-10 minutes and then the girl FINALLY brought the other two entrees!!! What kind of mentality do they have there?!? Other people were coming in after us AND THEY GOT THEIR FOOD!!! I wasn't going to eat my meal and then have to watch my friends eat their entrees in stages--at 10 minute intervals! My entree wasn't even that good and it got cold. I asked our waitress for more water. She didn't even look or acknowledge me in ANY way whatsoever! I said excuse me, hello! She just kept walking. I know she heard me! Then finally she came to our table with a water pitcher and filled our glasses. That proved she heard me and proceeded to ignore me. Our weekly lunches together are meant to be fun, pleasant and enjoyable. There are a million other places we could have gone to! I had heard they weren't very good any more but thought I'd give them a try. THERE IS NO WAY ON GOD'S GREEN EARTH WILL WE EVER DARKEN THEIR FRICKEN DOORSTEPS AGAIN! Panda Express at the mall food court  is 100% better than C-Fu!!! I do not recommend this place to anyone! The food tasted bland, not much flavor and I ordered sweet & sour chicken! How do you ruin that dish??? My friend ordered hot tea and got charged for it--there were 5 tiny leaves in the teapot! This place is bad news! Take my advice AND NEVER GO THERE!

05x2o5_w2WtWTBWj5lnyYQ.text: They are having a promo of buying 1 lobster get another 1 for free.  $38 for two lobsters.    You can only get them in one style of cooking.  It sounded good.  But then the lobsters were quite small.  It's probably a one-pounder each.  We ordered the clams with black bean sauce and some dim sum dishes to make the meal more filling.

FBOcrGY1jHT9EtkO4fIsWw.text: Horrible experience here doesn't even deserve to exist. They served my daughter RAW food and not even a sorry came out of their mouth. Who does that?! Let me tell you who: C-FU Gourmet

bVA8gfps9hstvva2jf63PQ.text: Disappointed.  Expected it to be crowed for being holiday but it was not.  Now I know why.  Very few dim sum choices,  seasame rice ball tasted like rotten.  My kids felt sick.  Also found a eye lash on the dim sum.  Gross!.  Never going back for such a unpleasant meal which costed me over $66 for two adults and kids.

63riUALBBllDWc92DMvfPQ.text: A Sunday tradition... great dim sum, inexpensive, awesome.    'nuff said.

s-MVbH4nL6VmtziTRlTukw.text: Great selection on the dinner menu and Seafood! I always come in for the C-Fu chicken, beef tenderloin, hong kong pan fried noodles, and many more...must try!  I also come here for their Dim Sum...esp on Saturdays and Sundays big selection of food...i love their chicken feet n baking goods! I see alot have been commenting on automatic tips added??? C-Fu Gourmet DOES NOT automatically add gratuity no matter how many is in your group...  Very nice staff and friendly environment. Must try! Two thumbs up!!!

_CVeAOLBOW0yuyHEwMgNGA.text: Been to C Fu many times.  Figured I may as well write a review now.   I've only been to C Fu for dim sum.  Since leaving my comfort zones of the Bay Area and Las Vegas, I was dying for dim sum.  What a gem this place is.  It's loud, crazy and over crowded on the weekends, but service is fast, nice and friendly.  I love the dim sum.  Dare I say I've found my all time favorite dim sum place ever?  I think I am going to!  We've taken some of my husband's co-workers to dim sum -- we think it may have been a bit too exotic and overwhelming for them.  We didn't care, we still ate.  A definite place to be for cheap group eats.

bbBPOUIpVW-BTm01Qjs3FQ.text: We just visited C-Fu Gourment this past weekend. We have tried other Chinese places and loved them, but was looking to try a new one. We decided on this location. My husband was skeptical at first (he wanted to try another one) but he finally agreed. I am so glad we went. We had our 4 year old with us and it wasn't very crowded. She loves Chinese food and trying to use chopsticks. One thing we noticed is that the menu did state MSG is used but speak to your server about other options. The other options was basically the server writing down no MSG. They are able to prepare any of the dishes without it. When our food came, the server also brought my daughter chopsticks without being asked. She loved that. She also loved the food and as promised, it contained no MSG (I get sick after eating MSG). The food was not very greasy. My husband had ordered a beef and bell pepper dish but didn't eat all the bell peppers. This is because he personally loves the flavor peppers brings, but doesn't like to eat alot of the actual peppers. The manager/owner came over and let us know they could customize any dish and he could just ask for no peppers next time. When my husband explained he likes the flavor, she smiled and went ah ok. I loved that the manager/owner had come over just to make sure everything was alright. The best thing is that this Chinese place caused no reaction. Sometimes when I eat Chinese food, I make a few trips to the bathroom  (even in places that state no MSG) but this was not the case. I didn't even need to go in once and neither did my husband. This has become a top favorite and we will be back.

Nv3jWgHeKt6u4MwQKvvvPg.text: Used to go here often for dim sum and have enjoyed the experience each time.  Although dim sum is served daily, I've only visited on Saturdays and Sundays.  Gets VERY crowded after 12pm, so try and arrive by 11am if you want a chance at the fresher selections.    Love their egg tarts, beef tripe, short ribs, mango custard, shu mai, sugar cane shrimp, and fried rice balls (with seasoned ground pork filling).    Be sure to try and ask for a table near the aisles as sometimes it's hard for the ladies to maneuver the carts in between tables.    Prices are decent for each dim sum item.  We sometimes order a couple of dishes off the regular menu, to supplement the smaller dim sum items.    Since PHX doesn't offer alot of dim sum options, C-Fu will remain my top choice for dim sum cravings.

7vo_kXhiob1BMij3g-Qo9A.text: The dim sum was pretty tasty the first time I went.   The second time I went,  we ordered vegetable fried rice...maybe the chef was having an off night, but the veggies were straight from the freezer bag and still cold. (you know, the little orange carrot cubes and peas from that mixed back in your local grocery store freezer?)  That off night turned us off to the place - how hard is to to chop some carrots up and stir fry with some rice..so we never went back.   Its big inside and the entry way has statues and such that are entertaining to look at. Stick with the Dim Sum.

FwS2IhT8fPUZjUUv9UJQKw.text: Love the dim sum on Sunday afternoons. Always end up bringing home a lot of leftovers as the little carts full of delicious food keep strolling by. Dim sum is a great way to try a variety of foods and this is a great place for it.

slA4Kinc-f86j4cqkXLd_g.text: A friend of my boyfriend recommended C-Fu Gourmet so we tried it on Xmas eve.  In spite of the fact that they were very busy, the food was still awesome!!!  The C-Fu Chicken and French Beef are incredible and the fried rice is the best in the valley!!  Oh, I forgot to mention the Coconut pudding and Snowballs...delish!  We went back the following week with friends...service and food were even better!!  This is our new Chinese restaurant!!!

ngrzdiLBokuq6e_Ysls35A.text: It hurts my inner Asian to give Dim Sum only two starts, but this place is lacking. This place would be out of business so quick if it were in California. I've been to take out Dim Sum places that would shame this place.   The best dish was probably just average, and there were some that were... not good. Please do not just Dim Sum from this place, its not a good representation.

FO9aAJOH6t1hzbc88ws_7Q.text: Still the best Dim Sum in the Valley.  Not quite up to Portland's standards, but it's right there.

ty7dvVUzDhjApvVQtpsSyQ.text: Wow, what a Gem  We are from the SF Bay area and great chinese food is hard to find.  We have done the dim sum which was great but the chinese dinners we have been having are even better.  We had the War Won Ton soup which was really tasty, chicken with black bean sauce was awesome, and the lobster with ginger and scallions was to die for.  We have eaten here about 10 times and will definitely come back.

Q2oCu7QBDvc5gABi8Ok2Nw.text: My husband and I both got sick after eating here.  How come there is always a line on the weekend?

tcB1QEgGfnclyLfSNtfdZw.text: Favorite dim sum in the valley. Large seating area and lots of carts roaming about. They have a large selection of dumplings and oth their traditional dim sum items. I recommend trying the chrysanthemum tea when you are there.  It is much more flavorful than green tea. The steamed BBQ pork buns are my favorite item.  Be sure to order to trays when the server comes by!

FVbtQgcCmWmQ-D6IR5BfZg.text: C-Fu has been rated the #1 Chinese restaurant in the Valley many times. It's menu is HUGE!  Amazing seafood here also.  Very fresh, very delicious!    One of the things I like about C-Fu is that there is a list of sauces and preparations and you decide what you want with it.  You want shrimp, tofu , and scallop Kung Pao? No problem. The combinations are endless.  Best dim sum around also. Lots of carts going around with lots of fresh items.  I went there with a couple of guys from Hong Kong, and they said it was some of the best dim sum they had had in the U.S.  One thing I did notice is that the REALLY obscure and odd stuff (deep fried chicken feet, tripe) comes around early in the service, and the more mainstream items (ribs, egg rolls) tend to come out after 11:30 or so.  Don't know if it's intentional, but it seems to be a trend.  Yes, it's loud and raucous, but from what I was told by the Hong Kong dudes, that's the way it is over there.  If you are looking for an austere Sunday brunch, C-Fu is not the place to go.

A4NTYqHXldejNVqXZujQNQ.text: So my husband and I have been coming here for quite some time.  We lived in Los Angeles and frequented many Dim Sum places there.  We also Visit Vancouver and get some great Chinese food from chinatown.  This restaurant is and has been a great representation of chinese food. Here in AZ there are many fast food places that dumb down there representation of chinese food.  Orange chicken and Sweet and sour chicken aren't the only fantastic dishes the chinese have to offer.  Broaden your culinary horizons and try something more authentic.  Try Dim sum ... It's awesome and fun!!

lT4ZABudEzKzKW_Dbu5kCg.text: Owie. My belly hurt after eating here.   I was looking forward to steamed veggies, but they didn't have any. Said they were out. Total bummer. So, I ate some shrimp spring rolls and sampled others. I steered clear of fried stuff, but it didn't seem to matter. My belly was upset almost immediately. Maybe it was the coconut bread. I couldn't help myself; it was super tasty!  After my friends had plucked something off the dessert cart, the server brought us some bok choy. I thought they were out, but I guess they had some hiding in the kitchen? Anyway, I ate that happily. It was the first time I ever tried bok choy. I'm a fan! Not of this place but of the super healthy veggie.   I think I'd rather go to YC's Mongolian Grill again before ever coming back here.

KF0TrGgBWG8wL5QSXI_qpw.text: I ate here for lunch today...am I missing something from all the rave reviews...  I had the Chicken Lo Mein, the quality of the chicken and lo mein noodles is cheap, the hot & sour soup was okay but nothing grand, fried rice was plain, and the egg rolls weren't spectacular.  My dining companions had general's chicken, and mongolian beef...and they didn't seem to like their meal ither.  Over all it was a 1 star, but the 2nd star for the price and the soup.

nfHdUybrsu1Xkt3Stjxpgw.text: The best dimsum in Chandler or Phoenix for that matter.  I think its the only dimsum in Phoenix!!!!!  Am giving this place 3 stars in relative scale to other dimsum places in Phoenix, not sure if there is any other...  Compared to its counterparts in LA and SF, errrr I would not say its as good as the average dimsum places in those cities...

mHzI6Bfatad_n79tPrXeiA.text: I have only been to their Dim Sum once, it had an amazing variety and the carts were always circulating and available. The prices were reasonable and all the food fresh and delicious especially the pastries. They didn't have a lot of vegetarian food which was a disappointment but I would go back anyway just to get a table full of their sesame balls (they are the best pastry I have ever had).   Mostly I go here for dinner. Their food is good, not the most amazing but they have big servings and the service is always good. The place is HUGE, they even have a karaoke section sort of walled off which I sometimes see people using I am guessing you have to book it or something.   My favorite part is that when they have pastries left over from Dim Sum they give them out for free after your meal, you don't always get one but when you do it makes you think "yes, I am the lucky one".

IZPSbPT726N3n1vfWCo04A.text: Service: it's ok for dim sum. They're pretty fast.   Environment: it looks like a traditional large Chinese restaurant where half is a restaurant and the other half is where people have wedding receptions.   Parking: lot, spacious.   Food: dim sum carts. Some of the foods were hit and miss. Taro fried cake was not good. I usually love it but it was not very crispy.

xedaFuLESMg1sll8YEjYKA.text: We were greeted and seated promptly.  Plenty of spots at their car park.  Inside the restaurant was a tad warm for us. Some of the guests dining were fanning themselves as well.  We arrived around 10:00 AM for DIMSUM.  Food carts (along with types of food) were only 4 roaming around versus 12 carts and a lot more variety of dishes.  Dishes we picked were delish. We placed an order but never received it. No worries though, we were not charged for it.  Overall, our experience was good.

jfamb-BLFUQyy09ncjSFrQ.text: I'm a bit disappointed. But its been a long time coming sadly. And it has finally happened

photos.caption: Photo of C-Fu Gourmet - Chandler, AZ, United States. They are now officially closed. For the small following like my self I am sad to see them go.

rpQKTQI9PboAZe40yp-SXQ.text: Mom likes this place for Yum Cha. Could be only the nostalgia of dim sum carts since they are getting harder to find, even in LA. Must make mention that the staff is very eager to please. So that is a plus.  I have my favorites and when I rattle them all off in Cantonese, a split-second dear in the headlight look, turns into a "fists of fury" scurry to bring them all! So this is very cute as it happens all the time.   Please see pic's of our order and you decide. Will come back 'cause for Mom its a must have every now and then.
